frameDefinitions: This frame contains verbs and nouns that communicate the act of a Speaker to address a Message to some Addressee using language.
A Communicator conveys a Message to an Addressee; the Topic and Medium of the communication also may be expressed.
A Speaker reveals Information that was previously secret to an Addressee.
An Author creates a Text, either written, such as a letter, or spoken, such as a speech,  that contains meaningful linguistic tokens, and may have a particular Addressee in mind.
An Agent has a choice of whether or not to participate in some Desirable_event because of an Opportunity, a situation not completely under the Agent's control and usually of a limited duration.
An Agent acts to begin the life of a Process.
frameExamples: I now <t>declare</t> you members of this Society.
Let's hope it did n't have time to <t>communicate</t> any of its findings to its overlords.
Could it be true that Martin himself was the one who <t>spilled</t> the <t>beans</t> on Pops and Brad's planned wedding?
I <t>penned</t> a letter concerning racism to Congress.
It would be pleasant in the <t>opportune</t> absence of the clergyman to have a dance . DNI
After discovering her knack for organization, she decided to try to  <t>launch</t> a career in human resources.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity that produces the <fen>Message</fen> (whether spoken or written).  It is normally expressed as the External Argument of predicative uses of the <t>target	</t> word, or as the Genitive modifier of the noun.
The <fen>Message</fen> is the role that identifies the content of what the <fen>Speaker</fen> is communicating to the <fen>Addressee</fen>.  It can be expressed as a clause or as a noun phrase.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It is normally expressed as a PP Complement headed by 'about', but in some cases it can appear as a direct object.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the statement.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Message</fen> is made.
The role specifies the location where the <fen>Message</fen> takes place.
The sentient entity that uses language in the written or spoken modality to convey a <fen>Message</fen> to the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
<fen>Message</fen> is a proposition or set of propositions that the <fen>Communicator</fen> wants the <fen>Addressee</fen> to believe or take for granted.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It is normally expressed as a PP Complement headed by 'about', but in some cases it can appear as a direct object.
The physical or abstract setting in which the <fen>Message</fen> is conveyed.
The time at which the communication takes place.
The location where the act of communication occurs.
The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity that reveals  the <fen>Information</fen> (whether spoken or written).
<fen>Information</fen> identifies the content that the <fen>Speaker</fen> reveals to the <fen>Addressee</fen>.  It can be expressed as a clause or as a noun phrase.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter about which the <fen>Speaker</fen> is speaking. It normally only appears with noun targets, or in special constructions.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the statement.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the revelation is made.
The role specifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Information</fen> is revealed.
The <fen>Author</fen> produces a particular <fen>Text</fen>.
The entity which results from the act of writing or speaking.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which the text is created.
Where the event takes place.
The situation during which the <fen>Desirable_situation</fen> is possible. For nominal LUs, this is generally in the second layer and contains the target.
The sentient agent that may or may not participate in the <fen>Desirable_situation</fen>.
A situation or event that the <fen>Agent</fen> can participating in during the period of the <fen>Opportunity</fen>.
This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate the process that the <fen>Agent</fen> initiates.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the actor responsible for starting the <fen>Process</fen>.
This role is for the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> initiates the <fen>Process</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Process</fen> is initiated.
listRoleExamples: Evelyn said <fex>that she was not ready to leave</fex>.
Kim preached to me <fex>over the phone</fex>.
In some remarks <fex>at the National Press Club</fex>, Mr. Keating said he would make a better prime minister tha nMr. Hawke.
<fex>He</fex> finds it hard to communicate with people, not least his separated parents .
How do you communicate to them <fex>that you really like them</fex> ?
Had someone communicated to the capital <fex>about the flagrant disregard of the religious law</fex> ?
Opinions are usually communicated <fex>over the telephone</fex> and are often given within 24 hours.
<fex>Kornfeldt</fex> revealed that he had embezzled more than twice the amount his company owned.
You shouldn't reveal <fex>any murders you've been involved in</fex>, if you know what I mean.
Revelations <fex>about the coming of the Christ</fex> surfaced in early Mediaeval times.
Kim confided in me <fex>over the phone</fex>.
According to the report, he confessed to eating onions and gargling with generic mouthwash <fex>at the station</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Divine Name in the Psalm, Ascribe
37 Destruction comes upon the enemies of Israel38
